intro: Ceropegia peulhorum, commonly known as the Cape flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a succulent shrub with fleshy, often hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky areas or along coastal regions. Ceropegia peulhorum is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
